name: freelance-proposal-writer
description: Inspired by u/ClawedPlatypus' viral Reddit post "Steal My $20k+ Copy Proposal Template" (r/copywriting, 69 upvotes, 27 comments — reddit.com/r/copywriting/comments/1kkkwbp). Paste your client brief and get a transformation-focused proposal that sells outcomes, not deliverables. Built on the framework: identify pain, articulate the future state, frame your work as the bridge. Structures pricing around value with tiered options.

client_brief.description: Everything you know about this client and project. Include: who they are, what they need, their current situation, any budget hints, their goals. The more detail you provide, the more specific the proposal. Paste notes from a discovery call, an email thread, or just describe the situation.

your_background.description: Your relevant experience, past results, and specialization. Include specific metrics if you have them (e.g. '40% conversion lift for a SaaS client'). If you're newer, describe relevant skills or adjacent experience.

service_type.description: What type of work is this? e.g. 'website copy', 'email sequences', 'brand messaging', 'sales page', 'content strategy', 'UX writing', 'ad copy'

budget_range.description: Approximate budget range if known, e.g. '$3k-$5k', '$10k+', 'unknown'. Helps calibrate the pricing tiers.

tone.description: Proposal tone. 'professional' is safe and polished. 'casual-confident' is more conversational. 'premium' positions you as a high-end specialist.

proposal.description: The complete transformation-focused proposal text ready to send

subject_line.description: Email subject line for sending the proposal

pricing_summary.description: Brief breakdown of the pricing tiers

scope_boundaries.description: What's explicitly NOT included to prevent scope creep

confidence_notes.description: Internal notes on what additional info would strengthen this proposal
